intro: Colobandra robusta, commonly known as the robust colobandra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, elliptical leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by red or orange berries. Colobandra robusta is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
